column4: hi guys... im new to ubuntu and i got a question regarding Nvidia.
my screen only gets to 640x480. i cant change it.
nvidia graphics cards require third party drivers. Install the driver and it would be fine.
enable the driver?
not enabled then.
i don't exactly remember the location:/ i would tell you after my ubuntu finishes installation
ok thx :D
^_^ do you have the nvidia settings application?
yes
which nvidia graphics card are we talking of here?
Geforce 250GTS
2560x1600 thats the maximum digital resolution. Open up the application and does it allow you to change the resolution? Also, is your monitor capable of going to such a resolution?
i can only change to 640x480. My monitor is an 22" monitor that can handle 1,680 x 1,050.
hold on. my gui update will finish in sometime.
ok thx
Are you done?
sadly there's still 10 minutes left. dang it its acting slow.
i have to install my nvidia geforce too, so i would be happy to check anyways:P
oh ok:P
btw how do i cd to a folder with a space in the terminal?
i will be back in 20 min.
